questions.question: If $x < 5$, then
questions.solution:
Multiplying an inequality by a negative number reverses the sign.
Given $x < 5$, multiplying by $-1$ gives $-x > -5$.

questions.question: Given $x \le 5$, then
questions.solution:
Multiplying an inequality by a negative number reverses the sign.
Given $x \le 5$, multiplying by $-1$ gives $-x \ge -5$.

questions.question: If $x$ is a real number and $|x| < 3$, then
questions.solution:
The inequality $|x| < a$ implies $-a < x < a$.
Here $|x| < 3 \implies -3 < x < 3$.

questions.question: $x$ and $b$ are real numbers. If $b > 0$ and $|x| > b$, then
questions.solution:
The inequality $|x| > a$ implies $x < -a$ or $x > a$.
Here $|x| > b \implies x < -b$ or $x > b$.
In interval notation: $x \in (-\infty, -b) \cup (b, \infty)$.

questions.question: The inequality representing the following graph is:
questions.diagram: <svg width='300' height='60' viewBox='0 0 300 60' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><line x1='10' y1='30' x2='290' y2='30' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><text x='150' y='50' text-anchor='middle'>0</text><text x='90' y='50' text-anchor='middle'>-5</text><text x='210' y='50' text-anchor='middle'>5</text><circle cx='90' cy='30' r='4' fill='white' stroke='red' stroke-width='2' /><circle cx='210' cy='30' r='4' fill='white' stroke='red' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='10' y1='30' x2='86' y2='30' stroke='red' stroke-width='4' /><line x1='214' y1='30' x2='290' y2='30' stroke='red' stroke-width='4' /><polygon points='10,30 20,25 20,35' fill='red' /><polygon points='290,30 280,25 280,35' fill='red' /></svg>
questions.solution:
The graph shows the region outside $-5$ and $5$ with open circles, meaning $x < -5$ or $x > 5$.
This corresponds to $|x| > 5$.

questions.question: The solution set of the inequality represented by the following graph is:
questions.diagram: <svg width='300' height='60' viewBox='0 0 300 60' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><line x1='10' y1='30' x2='290' y2='30' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><text x='150' y='50' text-anchor='middle'>5</text><circle cx='150' cy='30' r='4' fill='white' stroke='red' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='154' y1='30' x2='290' y2='30' stroke='red' stroke-width='4' /><polygon points='290,30 280,25 280,35' fill='red' /></svg>
questions.solution:
The graph shows values greater than 5 with an open circle at 5.
This represents the interval $(5, \infty)$.

questions.question: The solution set of the inequality represented by the following graph is:
questions.diagram: <svg width='300' height='60' viewBox='0 0 300 60' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><line x1='10' y1='30' x2='290' y2='30' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><text x='150' y='50' text-anchor='middle'>5</text><circle cx='150' cy='30' r='4' fill='red' stroke='red' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='10' y1='30' x2='150' y2='30' stroke='red' stroke-width='4' /><polygon points='10,30 20,25 20,35' fill='red' /></svg>
questions.solution:
The graph shows values less than or equal to 5 (closed circle).
This represents the interval $(-\infty, 5]$.

questions.question: The solution set of the inequality represented by the following graph is:
questions.diagram: <svg width='300' height='60' viewBox='0 0 300 60' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><line x1='10' y1='30' x2='290' y2='30' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><text x='150' y='50' text-anchor='middle'>5</text><circle cx='150' cy='30' r='4' fill='red' stroke='red' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='150' y1='30' x2='290' y2='30' stroke='red' stroke-width='4' /><polygon points='290,30 280,25 280,35' fill='red' /></svg>
questions.solution:
The graph shows values greater than or equal to 5 (closed circle).
This represents the interval $[5, \infty)$.

questions.question: The solution set of the inequality represented by the following graph is:
questions.diagram: <svg width='300' height='60' viewBox='0 0 300 60' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><line x1='10' y1='30' x2='290' y2='30' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><text x='150' y='50' text-anchor='middle'>5</text><circle cx='150' cy='30' r='4' fill='white' stroke='red' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='10' y1='30' x2='146' y2='30' stroke='red' stroke-width='4' /><polygon points='10,30 20,25 20,35' fill='red' /></svg>
questions.solution:
The graph shows values less than 5 with an open circle.
This represents the interval $(-\infty, 5)$.

questions.question:
State whether the following statements are True or False.
(i) If $x < y$ and $b < 0$, then $\frac{x}{b} < \frac{y}{b}$.
(ii) If $xy > 0$, then $x > 0$ and $y < 0$.
(iii) If $xy < 0$, then $x > 0$ and $y > 0$.
(iv) If $x > 5$ and $x > 2$, then $x \in (5, \infty)$.
(v) If $|x| < 5$, then $x \in (-5, 5)$.
(vi) Graph of $x > -2$ includes the line $x = -2$.
(vii) Solution set of $x - y \le 0$ includes $(1, 0)$.
questions.answer: (i) False, (ii) False, (iii) False, (iv) True, (v) True, (vi) False, (vii) False
questions.solution:
(i) False. Dividing by a negative number reverses the inequality. $\frac{x}{b} > \frac{y}{b}$.
(ii) False. If $xy > 0$, both $x, y$ are positive OR both are negative.
(iii) False. If $xy < 0$, they have opposite signs.
(iv) True. Intersection of $x > 5$ and $x > 2$ is $x > 5$.
(v) True. $|x| < 5 \implies -5 < x < 5$.
(vi) False. Strict inequality ($>$) does not include the boundary line.
(vii) False. Substitute $(1, 0)$: $1 - 0 = 1 \not\le 0$.

questions.question:
Fill in the blanks in the following:
(i) If $-4x \ge 12$, then $x$ ___ $-3$.
(ii) If $\frac{-3}{4}x \le -3$, then $x$ ___ $4$.
(iii) If $\frac{2}{x+2} > 0$, then $x$ ___ $-2$.
(iv) If $x > -5$, then $4x$ ___ $-20$.
(v) If $x > y$ and $z < 0$, then $-xz$ ___ $-yz$.
questions.solution:
(i) Divide by $-4$ (negative), reverse sign: $x \le -3$.
(ii) Multiply by $-4/3$ (negative), reverse sign: $x \ge (-3)(-4/3) = 4$.
(iii) Since numerator $2 > 0$, denominator must be positive: $x+2 > 0 \implies x > -2$.
(iv) Multiply by 4 (positive), sign stays: $4x > -20$.
(v) $x > y, z < 0 \implies xz < yz$ (multiply by negative). Then multiply by $-1$: $-xz > -yz$.
